Package ruleEngine.rules.atomicRules

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    CheckAreAligned
    Check if a unit is aligned with its target for an attack, this alignment is checked in the 8 directions from the source unit.
    CheckCanAttackUnit
    Check if a unit is allowed to attack or not.
    CheckCanMoveUnit
    Check if a unit can move or not.
    CheckIsAllyUnit
    Check if a unit is owned by the player requesting the move.
    CheckIsAttackingUnit
    Check if a unit is able to attack or not.
    CheckIsCharge
    Check if an attack performed by a unit could be a charge.
    CheckIsEmptyAttackPath
    Check if an attack performed by a unit is able to reach its destination, meaning there is no obstacle between the unit and the targeted cell.
    CheckIsEmptyPath
    Check if a move performed from a unit to its destination is clear from obstacles or next units.
    CheckIsEnemyUnit
    Check if the targeted unit from an attack is an enemy one.
    CheckIsInCommunication  
    CheckIsNoArsenalEnemy
    Check if all of the adversary's arsenals are destroyed or not, leading to the end of a game.
    CheckIsNoEnemy
    Check if there is no more enemy units on the board, leading to the end of the game.
    CheckIsPriorityUnit
    Check if a unit must retreat or not.
    CheckIsRelay
    Check if a unit is a Relay type unit.
    CheckLastMove
    Check if the unit attacking is the last one moved by the player, as a delayed attack or static attack isn't allowed from our rule interpretation.
    CheckNoPriorityUnitAlly
    Check if there's no unit that need to retreat before ending the turn.
    CheckOnBoard
    Check if an action is performing within the board boundaries.
    CheckPlayerMovesLeft
    Check if the player performing the action has at least one move remaining for this turn.
    CheckPlayerTurn
    Check if the action is performed by the right player on this turn.
    CheckUnitMP
    Check if a move performed by a unit is within its range of movement.
    CheckUnitRange
    Check if an attack performed by a unit is within its range of action.
